intro: Jacquinia keyensis, commonly known as Key's heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are often clustered at the base of the plant.
